page.title: 16WESTFIELD SCHOOL
page.content: Amid a residential area just north of Hoddesdon Town centre stands{Westfield {School.}It has 210 children on roll betwen the ages of 5 and 11. There are 7 classes of infants and juniors and a Special Unit taking up to 10 children with speech and language difficulties. The present headteacher has been at the school for 3 years although the school celebrates its 21st. birthday this year. The school building stands on the site of Westfield House, built in Queen Victoria's reign. There also used to be a windmill on the site and that is why the school badge has a windmill on it. There are several old chestnut trees in the grounds and two cedar of lebanons that once stood in the grounds of the house.
